Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class Client

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTTPClient, LDAPClient, RedisClient, SMTPClient
public abstract class Client extends Connector
Abstract base class for client-side connection factories.

This class extends Connector and adds client-specific functionality such as target host and port configuration, client-mode SSL engine setup, and asynchronous connection establishment.

Clients create outbound connections to remote servers using the same event-driven, non-blocking architecture as server-side connections. Protocol implementations provide a ClientHandler to receive connection events and protocol-specific data.

Standalone Usage (no SelectorLoop required)


 // Simple - Gumdrop infrastructure is managed automatically
 RedisClient client = new RedisClient("localhost", 6379);
 client.connect(new RedisConnectionReady() {
     public void handleReady(RedisSession session) {
         session.ping(handler);
     }
     // ... other callbacks
 });
 // Infrastructure auto-starts on connect, auto-stops when done

Server Integration (with SelectorLoop affinity)


 // In a server connection handler - use same SelectorLoop for efficiency
 public void handleRequest() {
     SelectorLoop myLoop = getSelectorLoop();
     RedisClient client = new RedisClient(myLoop, "localhost", 6379);
     client.connect(handler);
 }
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client(SelectorLoop selectorLoop, String host, int port) throws UnknownHostException
      Creates a client that will connect to the specified host and port, using the provided SelectorLoop for I/O.

      Use this constructor for server integration where you want the client to share a SelectorLoop with server connections.

      Parameters:
      selectorLoop - the SelectorLoop for connection I/O
      host - the target host as a String
      port - the target port number
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be resolved

    • Client

      public Client(SelectorLoop selectorLoop, InetAddress host, int port)
      Creates a client that will connect to the specified host and port, using the provided SelectorLoop for I/O.
      Parameters:
      selectorLoop - the SelectorLoop for connection I/O
      host - the target host as an InetAddress
      port - the target port number

    • Client

      public Client(String host, int port) throws UnknownHostException
      Creates a client that will connect to the specified host and port.

      A SelectorLoop will be obtained automatically from the Gumdrop infrastructure when connect(T) is called. The infrastructure is started automatically if needed and will shut down when all client connections close.

      Parameters:
      host - the target host as a String
      port - the target port number
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be resolved

    • Client

      public Client(InetAddress host, int port)
      Creates a client that will connect to the specified host and port.

      A SelectorLoop will be obtained automatically from the Gumdrop infrastructure when connect(T) is called.

      Parameters:
      host - the target host as an InetAddress
      port - the target port number

    • getSelectorLoop

      public SelectorLoop getSelectorLoop()
      Returns the SelectorLoop this client uses for connections.

      May return null before connect(T) is called if the client was created without an explicit SelectorLoop.

      Returns:
      the SelectorLoop, or null if not yet assigned

    • configureSSLEngine

      protected void configureSSLEngine(SSLEngine engine)
      Description copied from class: Connector
      Configures SSL engine settings. Default implementation sets useClientMode to false and configures SNI if enabled. Subclasses can override to add additional SSL configuration.
      Overrides:
      configureSSLEngine in class Connector
      Parameters:
      engine - the SSL engine to configure

    • newConnection

      protected final Connection newConnection(SocketChannel channel, SSLEngine engine)
      Creates a new connection instance for this client.

      This implementation throws UnsupportedOperationException because client connections require a ClientHandler. Use connect(T) instead.

      Specified by:
      newConnection in class Connector
      Parameters:
      channel - the socket channel for the connection
      engine - the SSL engine if this is a secure connection, or null
      Returns:
      never returns
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always

    • newConnection

      protected abstract Connection newConnection(SocketChannel channel, SSLEngine engine, ClientHandler handler)
      Creates a new connection instance for this client.

      This method is called by connect(ClientHandler) to create the appropriate connection type for the protocol.

      Parameters:
      channel - the socket channel for the connection
      engine - the SSL engine if this is a secure connection, or null
      handler - the client handler that will receive connection events
      Returns:
      a new connection instance configured for this protocol

    • connect

      public <T extends ClientHandler> void connect(T handler) throws IOException
      Initiates an asynchronous connection to the remote server.

      This method creates a non-blocking TCP connection to the configured host and port. The provided handler will receive events as the connection progresses through its lifecycle:

      • ClientHandler.onConnected(ConnectionInfo) when TCP connected
      • ClientHandler.onTLSStarted(TLSInfo) when TLS handshake completes
      • ClientHandler.onError(Exception) if connection fails
      • ClientHandler.onDisconnected() when the connection closes

      This method returns immediately and does not block. All subsequent interaction with the connection happens through the provided handler's callback methods.

      If no SelectorLoop was provided at construction time, this method automatically obtains one from the Gumdrop infrastructure, starting the infrastructure if necessary.

      Parameters:
      handler - the handler to receive connection events
      Throws:
      IOException - if the connection cannot be initiated

    • getDescription

      protected String getDescription()
      Description copied from class: Connector
      Returns a short (one word) description of this connector.
      Specified by:
      getDescription in class Connector
